abstracts.cdata!:
The Local Infrastructure Development
            Project for Gabon has two main objectives: 1) increasing
            access of the population living in low-income settlements to
            basic services; and 2) increasing access of small- and
            medium-sized enterprise (SME) to civil work and construction
            contracts with the public sector. The purpose of the
            restructuring is to: (i) focus on the project activities
            that are critical to achieve the Project Development
            Objective (PDO) by increasing their allocations to
            compensate for cost escalation; and (ii) reduce the scope of
            activities related to part of the project. The restructuring
            will involve: (a) streamlining a number of project
            activities; (b) reallocating among project components; and
            (c) simplifying some of the output indicators for added
            practicality and easier monitoring. As a result of the
            restructuring, it is expected that the PDO will be achieved
            and the implementation and monitoring of the project will
            improve. The restructuring is based on the following
            rationale: strengthen the focus of the project on the
            component targeting community-based infrastructure upgrading
            in low-income settlements, which are critical to achieve the
            PDO; and reduce the number and complexity of output
            indicators for easier monitoring.
